rv: Disruptive editing, violating article sanctions, runs against broad consensus reached, noted at [[Talk:Barack Obama/FAQ]]
and was too close to the last phrase. Same reason. As per the FAQ, african american and multiracial are exclusive terms. He is well know for being both African American and Multiracial.
Added Multiracial. As per the FAQ, African American and Multiracial are not mutually exclusive terms. He is well know as being both African American and Multiracial.

/* Foreign policy */ make that [[WP:MOSCAPS]]; same thing here, too
/* 2008 presidential campaign */ grammar: fix capitalization per [[WPMOSCAPS]]
grammar: need to clarify, otherwise [[Parallelism (grammar)|parallelism]] implies that he's the first African American (rather than the first president) born in Hawaii!
tighten wikilink; no need to link "was"
[[WP:SMS]] capitlized = capitilized. but nevermind the multiple sources; it's in the MoS anyway; see [[WP:MOSCAPS]]
grammar: "president" should not be capitlized if it does not immediately precede his name, e.g., "President Obama"; if needed, I can back this up with multiple sources
the lead probably should say at least a _few_ more words about the Nobel, which otherwise seems oddly understated for such a major event
